quote-text: This, you might object, is typical philosophical hairsplitting, avoiding the main issue: should you marry Halitosis Guy, or not? But Goodin’s argument is liberating. We imagine we have to decide between a life of settling, or one of striving. In fact, he points out, we must settle, in order to do anything worthwhile. Periodically, he suggests, review your balance of settling versus striving, to see if it’s time for a change, and new year is as good a time as any to take stock. But stop worrying about whether to settle: you are settling. Mercifully, you don’t have a choice.
quote-source: Oliver Burkeman, This column will change your life: settling, The Guardian, January 4, 2013
